access: Characters from Alkenstar have access to this archetype
markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Shieldmarshal Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=4040) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Impossible Lands](/Sources.aspx?ID=146) pg. 109</row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) As usual for archetypes, players who take the Shieldmarshal dedication feat can't select another dedication feat until they have gained two other feats from the Shieldmarshal archetype._

**Archetype** [Shieldmarshal](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=197)

**Access**
Characters from Alkenstar have access to this archetype

</column>

---

Your elite shieldmarshal training makes you equally at home in the squalor of Smokeside and the splendor of Skyside. You're intimately familiar with the city's labyrinthine streets and statutes. You become trained in [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14); if you were already trained, you become an expert in Society instead. In urban environments, you can attempt Society checks to [Sense Direction](/Actions.aspx?ID=64). You also gain the [Courtly Graces](/Feats.aspx?ID=772) and [Streetwise](/Feats.aspx?ID=846) skill feats.

<title level="2">Shieldmarshal Dedication leads to...</title>
[Consolidated Overlay Panopticon](/Feats.aspx?ID=4041), [Counterclockwork Focus](/Feats.aspx?ID=4043), [Equitable Defense](/Feats.aspx?ID=4042)
name: Shieldmarshal Dedication
